intro: Fagara nitida, commonly known as the glossy buckthorn, is a tropical plant native to Central and South America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its dark green, glossy leaves. The plant produces small, fragrant white flowers that are followed by red, fleshy berries. Fagara nitida is often found in moist, shaded areas of tropical forests. It has been used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
